full_summary:
# Passenger Vessel for Hire by Fisheries and Oceans Canada

## Title: Request for Proposal (RFP) - Passenger Vessel for Hire

### Brief Overview:

Fisheries and Oceans Canada is seeking to hire a passenger vessel to provide services for patrols and inspections in the waters adjacent to western Cape Breton, Nova Scotia.

### Services Required:

* Vessel with a length of 40-44 feet
* Crew of 3, including a Captain and 2 crew members
* Customized to accommodate stacking of 25 crab traps or 50 lobster traps
* Capable of achieving a minimum speed of 20 knots and maintaining a cruise speed of 20kts or above for a prolonged period
* Equipped with an acceptable lavatory facility and at least one 110V outlet available to Fishery Officers

### Key Activities:

* Patrol mid-shore and coastal areas in Snow Crab, lobster, rock crab, herring, recreational mackerel, striped bass, tuna, and groundfish fisheries, among others
* Conduct gear inspections and hauling of fishing gear and apparatuses
* Assist Fishery Officers in boarding and inspections as requested

### Tender Requirements:

* The vessel must be suitable for the services required and meet the specifications outlined above
* The bidder must provide a comprehensive proposal, including:
	+ Vessel details, including dimensions, engine performance, and other relevant specifications
	+ Crew information, including qualifications, experience, and availability
	+ Safety equipment and emergency procedures, including those related to fishing gear and personnel
	+ Any other relevant details related to the vessel's suitability for the services required

### Contact Information:

* Martin, Kimberly (DFO Tenders and Solicitations)
* Email: [DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
* Phone: 506-429-2397

### Documents:

* Request for Proposal (RFP) document for download from Canada Buys

### Deadline:

* Tender closing date: Friday, March 24, 2023 at 1:00 p.m. (Atlantic Time) Note: This tender is no longer active as it has already expired.
